sen.j: 久多（くた）は京都府京都市左京区の最北端に位置する地名である。
sen.e: Kuta is the name of an area located at the most northern part of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto prefecture.
Kuta is the name of an area located at the most northern part of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto prefecture.
Kuta is the name of an area located at the most northern part of Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 川合町（かわいちょう）・下の町（しものちょう）・宮の町（みやのちょう）・中の町（なかのちょう）・上の町（かみのちょう）の五つの集落から成る。
sen.e: It comprises five communities of Kawai Cho, Shimo no Cho, Miya no Cho, Naka no Cho and Kami no Cho.
It comprises five communities of Kawai Cho, Shimo no Cho, Miya no Cho, Naka no Cho and Kami no Cho.
It comprises five communities of Kawai-cho, Shimono-cho, Miyano-cho, Nakano-cho and Kamino-cho.

sen.j: 茅葺屋根の民家が残る地域であるが、近年過疎化が進んでいる。
sen.e: Thached private houses still remain in this area, but the population has been declining increasingly..
Thached private houses still remain in this area, but the population has been increasingly on the decline.
Thatched private houses still remain in this area, but the population has been increasingly on the decline.

sen.j: 郵便番号は京都府道110号久多広河原線が冬季閉鎖されて花脊峠方面から久多に進入できないという制約のため滋賀県大津市の堅田郵便局が集配を行っている。
sen.e: The postal codes: Since access to the area from the Hanase-toge Pass side is prevented in the winter season, due to the closure of the Kuta Hirogawara route of Kyoto Prefectural road 110, the Katata post office in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, handles the collecting and distributing operations there.

Postal codes: Since access to the area from the Hanase-toge Pass side is prevented in the winter season, due to the closure of the Kuta Hirogawara route of Kyoto Prefectural road 110, the Katata post office in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, handles the collecting and distributing operations there.

ZIP codes: Since access to the area from the Hanase-toge Pass side is prevented in the winter season, due to the closure of the Kuta Hirogawara Line of Kyoto Prefectural Route 110, the Katata post office in Otsu City, Shiga Prefecture, handles the collecting and distributing operations there.

sen.j: そのため久多の各町は滋賀県で使われる郵便番号の上2桁「52」を付して次の通りになっている。
sen.e: Therefore: "52" of the initial two digits of the postal codes for Shiga Prefecture is used as well for the postal code of each "Cho" in the Kuta area, and each postal code becomes as follows:
Therefore: "52" of the initial two digits of the postal codes for Shiga Prefecture is used as well for the postal code of each "Cho" in the Kuta area, and each postal code is as follows:
Therefore: '52' of the initial two digits of the ZIP codes for Shiga Prefecture is used as well for the ZIP code of each "cho" (town) in the Kuta area, and each ZIP code is as follows:
520-0461 (forKawai Cho), 520-0462 (Shimo no Cho), 520-0463 (Miya no Cho), 520-0464 (Naka no Cho), and 520-0465 (Kami no Cho.)

sen.j: 市外局番は京都市と同様「075」、市内局番は「748」局になっている(自動化された1977年までは「0759998」という7桁市外局番で市内局番はなかった)。
sen.e: The area code is 075, the same as that for Kyoto City, and the local exchange number is 748 (until 1977 when the exchange operation was automated, the area code was seven digits of "0759998," with no local exchange number.

The area code is 075, the same as that for Kyoto City, and the local exchange number is 748 (until 1977 when the exchange operation was automated, the area code was seven digits of "0759998," with no local exchange number.)

sen.j: 一般的な携帯電話は各社とも全域にわたり圏外であるため、移動体通信を行いたい場合はインマルサットやワイドスターの衛星電話を使うか、アマチュア無線を使う必要がある。
sen.e: Since no ordinary cell phones of any cell phone companies are not supported in this area, you must use a satellite telephone utilizing INMARISAT or WIDESTAR or amatuer radio when you need making a movable communication.
Since no mobile phones by any cell phone company are supported in this area, satellite telephones utilizing INMARISAT, WIDESTAR or amatuer radio are the only means of mobile communication.
Since no mobile phones by any cell phone company are supported in this area, satellite telephones utilizing INMARSAT, WIDESTAR or amateur radio are the only means of mobile communication.

sen.j: ISDNは使用可能だが、ADSLやFTTHといった今日的な通信サービスは一切提供されておらず、携帯電話網も含めて今後整備される見通しは立っていない。
sen.e: ISDN is usable but no advanced communication services, such as ADSL and FTTH, are available, with no prospect of these services, including a cell-phone network, being provided.
ISDN is usable but no advanced communication services, such as ADSL and FTTH, are available, with no prospect of these services, including a cell-phone network, being provided.

sen.j: 標高800～900メートルの山間部に位置するため、夏は冷涼な気候であるのに対して冬は寒さが厳しく豪雪でもある。
sen.e: Since the area is in the altitudes of 800 m to 900 m and mountaneous, it is cool in the summer but very cold in the winterwith lots of snow as well.

sen.j: 久多の大杉大川神社に立つ、樹高約40メートル、幹周約6.6メートルの大木。

sen.j: 平安時代以前から木材の供給地として開かれていた。
sen.e: This area was already developed in the pre-Heian period as an area for supplying wood.
This area was already developed in the pre-Heian period as an area for supplying wood.
This area was already developed in the pre-Heian period as an area for supplying wood.

sen.j: 一説によると平家の落人が逃れてきたとも言われている。
sen.e: According to one theory, it is said that Heike fugitives lived in this area.
According to one theory, it is said that Heike fugitives lived in this area.

sen.j: 江戸時代には近江国朽木藩所領となる。
sen.e: In the Edo period, this area belonged to Kutsuki Domain in Omi Province.
In the Edo period, this area belonged to Kutsuki Domain in Omi Province.
In the Edo period, this area belonged to Kutsuki Domain in Omi Province.

sen.j: 明治には京都府の管轄となる。
sen.e: In the Meiji era, it was placed under direct control of Kyoto Prefecture.
In the Meiji era, it was placed under direct control of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 旧愛宕郡久多村。

sen.j: 1949年4月1日に京都市左京区に編入される。
sen.e: On April 1, 1941, the area was merged into Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City.
On April 1, 1941, the area was merged into Sakyo Ward of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 産業
sen.e: Industries
Industries
Industries

sen.j: 従来は杉を中心とする天然木の供給や炭の生産によって生計を立てていたが、高度経済成長期に外材輸入量が増加したことにより、林業中心の産業形態は変容を迫られた。
sen.e: In the past, the peple in the area earned their living by supplying natural wood or by producing charcoal, but with the amount of imported imber increasing in the high economic growth period, they have been forced to change their forest-centerd industry.

In the past, the people in the area earned their living by supplying natural wood or by producing charcoal, but with the amount of imported imber increasing in the high economic growth period, they have been forced to change their forest-centered industry.

In the past, the people in the area earned their living by supplying natural wood or by producing charcoal, which is centered on Japanese cedars, but with the amount of imported lumber increasing in the high economic growth period, they have been forced to change their forest-centered industry.

sen.j: 農作物として甘藷の栽培や山菜加工が開始される一方、キャンプ場などのアウトドア施設が作られた。
sen.e: For farm products, the cultivation of sweet potatoes and the processing of wilde vegetables have been started, and outdoor facilities, such as campe sites, have been constructed.
Growing of sweet potatoes and the processing of wilde vegetables has been initiated, with outdooor facilities including camp sites having been constructed.

sen.e: Traditional events
Traditional events
Traditional events

sen.j: 久多には花笠踊をはじめとする様々な伝統行事が残っており、国や京都市に文化財として指定・登録されているものも多い。
sen.e: In the Kuta area, many traditional events, such as Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance), remain, and many of them are designated and registered as cultural assets by the nation or Kyoto City.
In the Kuta area, many traditional events, such as Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance), remain, and many of them are designated and registered as cultural assets by the nation or Kyoto City.

sen.j: 花笠踊
sen.e: Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance)
Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance)
Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance)

sen.j: 花笠踊（はながさおどり）は志古淵神社への豊作祈願・五穀豊穣の成就に感謝して踊られる祭りである。
sen.e: The Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance) festival is for praying Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine for a good harvest and for thanking for an accomplishment of a good harvest of various grains.
The Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance) festival is for praying Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine for a good harvest and being thankful for a good harvest of various grains.
The Hanagasa-odori Dance (flower-hat dance) festival is for praying Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine for a good harvest and being thankful for a good harvest of various grains.

sen.j: 室町時代に京で流行した風流踊の流れを汲み、地域的特色の見られる重要なものとして、1972年8月5日に国の選択無形民族文化財に、1997年（平成9年）12月15日には国の重要無形民族文化財に指定された。
sen.e: The dance originaties in the Fuyu-odori Dance that was played widely in Kyoto in the Muromachi Period, and, because local characteristics are explicitly seen in the dance, it was judged to be important and was designated as a selected intagible national cultural asset on August 5, 1972 and as an important intagible national cultural asset on December 15, 1997.

The dance originaties in the Fuyu-odori Dance that was played widely in Kyoto in the Muromachi Period, and, because local characteristics are explicitly seen in the dance, it was judged to be important and was designated as a selected intagible national cultural asset on August 5, 1972 and as an important intagible national cultural asset on December 15, 1997.

The dance originates in the Furyu-odori Dance that was played widely in Kyoto in the Muromachi period, and, because local characteristics are explicitly seen in the dance, it was judged to be important and was designated as a selected intangible national cultural asset on August 5, 1972 and as an important intangible national cultural asset on December 15, 1997.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 毎年8月24日に行われていたが、近年は24日の直近の日曜に行われる。
sen.e: The dance was played on August 24 every year, but recently, on the Sunday nearest to the 24th of August.
The dance was played on August 24 every year, but recently, on the Sunday nearest to the 24th of August.
The dance was played on August 24 every year, but recently, on the Sunday nearest to August 24.
sen.cmt: 日付の表現を変更しました。

sen.j: 花笠踊の特徴は美しい造花を飾った花笠と呼ばれる風流灯籠を用いることである。
sen.e: A feature of Hanagasa-odori Dance is that elegant lanterns called Hanagasa (flower hat) adorned with artificail flowers are used.
A feature of Hanagasa-odori Dance is that elegant lanterns called Hanagasa (flower hat) adorned with artificail flowers are used.
A feature of Hanagasa-odori Dance is that elegant lanterns called Hanagasa (flower hat) adorned with artificial flowers are used.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 花笠は久多の男衆によって毎年新しく作られ、造花の種類は、ダリア、牡丹、菊、バラ、朝顔、あやめなど約50種類ほどあり、材料は主に和紙を用いる。
sen.e: Hanagasa are made newly every year by male adults in the Kuta area, and flowers of around fifty species, such as dahlia, peony, chrysanthemum, rose, morning glory and iris, are made mostly using Japanese paper.

Hanagasa are made every year by male adults in the Kuta area, and flowers of around fifty species, such as dahlia, peony, chrysanthemum, rose, morning glory and iris, are made mostly using Japanese paper.

Hanagasa are made every year by male adults in the Kuta area, and flowers of around fifty species, such as dahlia, peony, chrysanthemum, rose, morning glory and iris, are made mostly using Japanese paper.

sen.j: 松上げ
sen.e: The Matsuage festival
The Matsuage festival
The Matsuage festival

sen.j: 宮の町の松上げは愛宕山への献火行事で、久多では「チャチャンコ」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The Matsuage festival in Miya no Cho is an event to offer fire forAtago-yama Mountain and is called "Chachanko" in the Kuta area.
The Matsuage festival in Miya no Cho is an event to offer fire for Atago-yama Mountain and is called "Chachanko" in the Kuta area.
The Matsuage festival in Miyano-cho is an event to offer fire for Mt. Atago and is called 'Chachanko' in the Kuta area.

sen.j: 毎年8月23日の夜に行われる。
sen.e: The festival is held in the night of the 23th of August, every year.
The festival is held in the night of the 23th of August, every year.
The festival is held in the night of August 23, every year.

sen.j: 松で作られた「柱松」と呼ばれる高さ約10メートルの塔状のものが設置され、その頂上に付けられた逆円錐形の傘めがけ手松明を投げ上げる祭である。
sen.e: In the festival, an approx. 10-m high tower-like thing called Hashira Matsu, made of pine, is constructed, and hand-held torches are thrown targeting at the inverse-corn-shaped umbrella attached to the top of Hashira Matsu

This is a mountain god-worshiping festival held at Shikobuchi-jinja Shrine on January 3, every year.

sen.j: 「エビ」と呼ばれる特殊な履物を履いた神社の氏子が弓を引く。

sen.e: On June 1, 1984, this festival was designated and registered as an intangible local cultural asset of Kyoto City.
On June 1, 1984, this festival was designated and registered as an intangible local cultural asset of Kyoto City.
On April 1, 1998, this festival was designated and registered as an intangible local cultural asset of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 川地蔵
sen.e: Kawa (river) jizo
Kawa (river) jizo
Kawa (river) jizo

sen.j: 地蔵盆の行事。
sen.e: A Jizo-bon event
A Jizo-bon event
A Jizo-bon event (an event to commemorate Jizo as the protector of children)
sen.cmt: 地蔵盆の補足を説明しました。

sen.j: 毎年8月14日の夕方，久多川に川原の小石と砂で地蔵を六体つくり霊を迎える。
sen.e: In the evening of the 14th of August, every year, six jizoes are built on the river-side field of Kuta-gawa River to invite spirits.
In the evening of the 14th of August, every year, six jizoes are built on the river-side field of Kuta-gawa River to invite spirits.
In the evening of August 14 every year, six jizoes are built with pebbles and sands of the river-side field of Kuta-gawa River to invite spirits.
sen.cmt: 日付の表現を変更しました。翻訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 翌15日朝に米・ナス・ダンゴ・シキビ・盆花・菓子・線香を供え，鉦を鳴らして十三仏念仏を唱えお参りする。
sen.e: In the morning of the next day (the 15th), people of the area pay a visit to the jizoes by placing in front of them rice, eggplant, rice dumpling, shikibi (a special tree for Buddhist events), flowers for Bon (a buddhist event in the summer in which each househould invites its ancestors' spirit to the house), sweet stuff and incense sticks, by striking Sho (a kind of percussion) and by repeating the name of Budda for 13 Buddas.

In the morning of the next day (the 15th), people of the area pay a visit to the jizoes by placing in front of them rice, eggplant, rice dumpling, shikibi (a special tree for Buddhist events), flowers for Bon (a buddhist event in the summer in which each househould invites its ancestors' spirit to the house), sweet stuff and incense sticks, by striking Sho (a kind of percussion) and by repeating the name of Budda for 13 Buddas.

In the morning of the next day (August 15), people of the area pay a visit to the jizoes by placing in front of them rice, eggplant, rice dumpling, shikibi (a special tree for Buddhist events), flowers for Bon (a Buddhist event in the summer in which each household invites its ancestors' spirit to the house), sweet stuff and incense sticks, by striking Sho (a kind of percussion) and by repeating the names of thirteen Buddha's.
sen.cmt: 日付の表現を変更しました。数字をスペルアウトしました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 久多の産土（うぶすな）神であり安曇川沿い一円の地主神を祀る神社。

sen.j: 延暦12年(793年)建立。
